ci_support_linux_64_channel_sourcesconda:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge,conda-forge/label/python_rc
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pcre:
- '8'
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.14.* *_cp314
target_platform:
- linux-64
tinyxml2:
- '11.0'
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - cxx_compiler_version
- - python
  - channel_sources

about.description:
Cppcheck is a static analysis tool for C/C++ code. Unlike C/C++ compilers and many other
analysis tools it does not detect syntax errors in the code.
Cppcheck primarily detects the types of bugs that the compilers normally do not detect.
The goal is to detect only real errors in the code (i.e. have zero false
positives).
about.summary: A static analysis tool for C/C++ code.

name: cppcheck

about.description:
Cppcheck is a static analysis tool for C/C++ code. Unlike C/C++ compilers and many other
analysis tools it does not detect syntax errors in the code.
Cppcheck primarily detects the types of bugs that the compilers normally do not detect.
The goal is to detect only real errors in the code (i.e. have zero false
positives).
about.summary: A static analysis tool for C/C++ code.

about.description:
Cppcheck is a static analysis tool for C/C++ code. Unlike C/C++ compilers and many other
analysis tools it does not detect syntax errors in the code.
Cppcheck primarily detects the types of bugs that the compilers normally do not detect.
The goal is to detect only real errors in the code (i.e. have zero false

about.summary: A static analysis tool for C/C++ code.

raw_meta_yaml:
context:
  name: cppcheck
  version: "2.18.3"

package:
  name: ${{ name|lower }}
  version: ${{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/danmar/cppcheck/archive/${{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: e37c94e190cdddc65682649b02b72939761585bddd8ada595f922e190a26a2be

build:
  number: 1

requirements:
  build:
    - if: build_platform != target_platform
      then:
        - python
        - cross-python_${{ target_platform }}
    - ${{ compiler('c') }}
    - ${{ compiler('cxx') }}
    - ${{ stdlib('c') }}
    - ninja
    - cmake
  host:
    - python
    - pip
    - setuptools >=45
    - setuptools-scm >=3.4
    - pcre
    - tinyxml2
  run:
    - pygments
    - python

tests:
  - script:
      - cppcheck --version
      - if: unix
        then: "test \"$(cppcheck --version)\" == \"Cppcheck $PKG_VERSION\""
      - "echo ';' > test.h; cppcheck --check-config test.h"


about:
  description: |
    Cppcheck is a static analysis tool for C/C++ code. Unlike C/C++ compilers and many other
    analysis tools it does not detect syntax errors in the code.
    Cppcheck primarily detects the types of bugs that the compilers normally do not detect.
    The goal is to detect only real errors in the code (i.e. have zero false
    positives).
  license: GPL-3.0-or-later
  license_file: COPYING
  summary: A static analysis tool for C/C++ code.
  homepage: http://cppcheck.sourceforge.net/
  repository: https://github.com/danmar/cppcheck

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - timsnyder
    - tovrstra
    - seanyen
    - wolfv

about.description:
Cppcheck is a static analysis tool for C/C++ code. Unlike C/C++ compilers and many other
analysis tools it does not detect syntax errors in the code.
Cppcheck primarily detects the types of bugs that the compilers normally do not detect.
The goal is to detect only real errors in the code (i.e. have zero false
positives).
about.summary: A static analysis tool for C/C++ code.
